schema.title: Response Api Multicam Get Api Aquisition Multicam Get
Response Api Postprocess Multicam Set Api Aquisition Multicam Postprocess Post

get.description: set backends to preview or capture mode (usually automatically switched as needed by processingservice)

schema.title: Response Api Getitems Api Mediacollection  Get

get.summary: Api Download Item Id Get Sharelinks

get.description: Eventstream to feed clients with server generated events and data

patch.description:
Update the configuration for appconfig (configurable=app) or a plugin (example configurable="photobooth.plugins.gpio_lights")
The configuration is persisted also after update.
updated_config is a generic type valid to receive json objects instead of a pydantic model because depending on the configurable
the model is different.

Args:
    configurable (str): app for appconfig, otherwise str with plugin name to update the config for. Defaults to None.
    updated_config (dict[AnyStr, Any]): valid json that is validated against appconfig or plugin config pydantic models

schema.title: Response Api Get Serial Ports Api Admin Enumerate Serialports Get
Response Api Get Usbcameras Api Admin Enumerate Usbcameras Get
Response Get Search Api Admin Enumerate Userfiles Get
Response Get List Api Admin Files List  Dir  Get

post.description: need to provide full path starting from CWD.

get.description:
Warning: deletes all files permanently without any further confirmation

Raises:
    HTTPException: _description_

post.description:
Post files to calculate a new calibration, save it and reload services to apply the calibration.

filess_in = [
    [Path("./tmp/calib_test_in/input_0.jpg"),...],  # camera 0
    [Path("./tmp/calib_test_in/input_1.jpg"),...],  # camera 1
    [Path("./tmp/calib_test_in/input_2.jpg"),...],  # ...
    [Path("./tmp/calib_test_in/input_3.jpg"),...],
]

head.description: head used for download portal to check if the file is available without downloading it.

get.description: if private.css exists return the file content, otherwise send empty response to avoid 404

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

AnimationConfigurationSet.title: Postprocess animation captures
AnimationConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

canvas_width.title: Canvas Width
canvas_width.description: Width (X) in pixel of animation image (GIF). The higher the better the quality but also longer time to process. All processes keep aspect ratio.

canvas_height.title: Canvas Height
canvas_height.description: Height (Y) in pixel of animation image (GIF). The higher the better the quality but also longer time to process. All processes keep aspect ratio.

merge_definition.title: Merge Definition
merge_definition.description: Sequence images in an animated GIF. Predefined image files are used instead a camera capture. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

AnimationProcessing.title: Animation (GIF) processing after capture
AnimationProcessing.description: Configure stages how to process collage after capture.

default.FRONTPAGE_TEXT:
Hey!
Let's take some pictures!
📷
default.GALLERY_EMPTY_MSG:
Empty, Zero, Nada! 🤷‍♂️
Let's take some pictures!
📷💕
default.qrcode_text_below: Scan above code with your phone.

AppConfig.title: AppConfig
AppConfig.description:
AppConfig class glueing all together

In the case where a value is specified for the same Settings field in multiple ways, the selected value is determined as follows
(in descending order of priority):

1 Arguments passed to the Settings class initialiser.
2 Environment variables, e.g. my_prefix_special_function as described above.
3 Variables loaded from a dotenv (.env) file.
4 Variables loaded from the secrets directory.
5 The default field values for the Settings model.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

CollageConfigurationSet.title: Postprocess collage captures
CollageConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

capture_remove_background.title: Capture Remove Background
capture_remove_background.description: Use AI to remove the background from the captured image. Results may vary. There are different models available in the mediaprocessing section.

capture_fill_background_enable.title: Capture Fill Background Enable
capture_fill_background_enable.description: Apply solid color background to captured image (useful only if image is extended or background removed)

capture_fill_background_color.title: Capture Fill Background Color
capture_fill_background_color.description: Solid color used to fill background.

capture_img_background_enable.title: Capture Img Background Enable
capture_img_background_enable.description: Add image from file to background (useful only if image is extended or background removed)

capture_img_background_file.title: Capture Img Background File
capture_img_background_file.description: Image file to use as background filling transparent area. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

canvas_width.title: Canvas Width
canvas_width.description: Width (X) in pixel of collage image. The higher the better the quality but also longer time to process. All processes keep aspect ratio.

canvas_height.title: Canvas Height
canvas_height.description: Height (Y) in pixel of collage image. The higher the better the quality but also longer time to process. All processes keep aspect ratio.

merge_definition.title: Merge Definition
merge_definition.description: How to arrange single images in the collage. Pos_x/Pos_y measure in pixel starting 0/0 at top-left in image. Width/Height in pixels. Aspect ratio is kept always. Predefined image files are used instead a camera capture. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

canvas_fill_background_enable.title: Canvas Fill Background Enable
canvas_fill_background_enable.description: Apply solid color background to collage

canvas_fill_background_color.title: Canvas Fill Background Color
canvas_fill_background_color.description: Solid color used to fill background.

canvas_img_background_enable.title: Canvas Img Background Enable
canvas_img_background_enable.description: Add image from file to background.

canvas_img_background_file.title: Canvas Img Background File
canvas_img_background_file.description: Image file to use as background filling transparent area. File needs to be located in userdata/*

canvas_img_front_file.title: Canvas Img Front File
canvas_img_front_file.description: Image file to paste on top over photos and backgrounds. Photos are visible only through transparant parts. Image needs to be transparent (PNG). File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

canvas_texts.title: Canvas Texts
canvas_texts.description: Text to overlay on final collage. Pos_x/Pos_y measure in pixel starting 0/0 at top-left in image. Font to use in text stages. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

CollageProcessing.title: Collage processing
CollageProcessing.description: Configure stages how to process collage after capture.

DimensionTypes.title: DimensionTypes
DimensionTypes.description:
SQLalchemy persists the name, fastapi validates against the value.
We just set name==value so it works in both worlds without any conversion.
Ref: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi/discussions/11098

pin.title: Pin
pin.description: GPIO the button is connected to.

trigger_on.title: Trigger On
trigger_on.description: Trigger action when button pressed (contact closed), released (contact open after closed) or longpress (hold for 0.6 seconds).

GpioTrigger.title: GPIO triggers configuration
GpioTrigger.description: Configure trigger the user can interact with. Sources are GPIO and keyboard.

collage.title: Collage
collage.description: Capture collages consist of one or more still images.

animation.title: Animation
animation.description: Capture GIF animation sequence consist of one or more still images. It's not a video but a low number of still images.

video.title: Video
video.description: Capture videos from live streaming backend.

multicamera.title: Multicamera
multicamera.description: Capture wigglegrams from a multicamera backend.

GroupActions.title: Actions configuration
GroupActions.description: Configure actions like capture photo, video, collage and animations.

enabled.title: Load and start backend
enabled.description: Selected device will be loaded and started.

GroupBackend.title: Camera Configuration
GroupBackend.description:
Choose backends for still images/high quality images captured on main backend.
If the livepreview is enabled, the video is captured from live backend (if configured)
or main backend.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

gcapture_target.title: Gcapture Target
gcapture_target.description: Set capture target (examples: 'Internal RAM', 'Memory card'). To keep images, capture to a disk target. Empty means default of camera (mostly RAM).

disable_viewfinder_before_capture.title: Disable Viewfinder Before Capture
disable_viewfinder_before_capture.description: Disable viewfinder before capture might speed up following capture autofocus. Might not work with every camera.

iso_liveview.title: Iso Liveview
iso_liveview.description: Sets the ISO for when the photobooth is in live preview modus. Very useful, when Camera does not support Exposure Simulation, and an external Flash is used. Only works when the camera is in manual. (Example Values: Auto, 100, 200, ...)

iso_capture.title: Iso Capture
iso_capture.description: Sets the ISO for when the photobooth captures a photo. Very useful, when Camera does not support Exposure Simulation, and an external Flash is used. Only works when the camera is in manual. (Example Values: Auto, 100, 200, ...)

shutter_speed_liveview.title: Shutter Speed Liveview
shutter_speed_liveview.description: Sets the shutter speed for the camera during the photobooth's live preview mode. Very useful, when Camera does not support Exposure Simulation, and an external Flash is used. This setting is effective only when the camera is in manual mode. (Example Values: 1, 1/5, 1/20, 1/30, 1/60, 1/1000, 1/4000, ...) Choose a very high default shutter speed in combination with Auto iso to emulate auto exposure.

shutter_speed_capture.title: Shutter Speed Capture
shutter_speed_capture.description: Configures the shutter speed for the camera at the time of capturing a photo in the photobooth. Very useful, when Camera does not support Exposure Simulation, and an external Flash is used. Operational only in manual mode. (Example Values: 1/60, 1/320, 1/1000, 1/2000, 1/4000, ...)

canon_eosmoviemode.title: Canon Eosmoviemode
canon_eosmoviemode.description: Canon specific. Switch on/off eosmoviemode when streaming videos. Might not work with every camera.

pause_camera_on_livestream_inactive.title: Pause Camera On Livestream Inactive
pause_camera_on_livestream_inactive.description: When enabled, the app tries to disable the cameras livestream when no livestream is requested. It helps to avoid sensor overheating for older cameras by setting viewfinder=0.

timeout_until_inactive.title: Timeout Until Inactive
timeout_until_inactive.description: Delay after which the livestream is considered as inactive and camera should idle.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

CAPTURE_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.title: Capture Cam Resolution Width
CAPTURE_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.description: camera resolution width to capture high resolution photo

CAPTURE_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.title: Capture Cam Resolution Height
CAPTURE_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.description: camera resolution height to capture high resolution photo

PREVIEW_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.title: Preview Cam Resolution Width
PREVIEW_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.description: camera resolution width to capture live video

PREVIEW_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.title: Preview Cam Resolution Height
PREVIEW_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.description: camera resolution height to capture live video

LIVEVIEW_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.title: Liveview Resolution Width
LIVEVIEW_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.description: actual resolution width for liveview stream

LIVEVIEW_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.title: Liveview Resolution Height
LIVEVIEW_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.description: actual resolution height for liveview stream

framerate_still_mode.title: Framerate Still Mode
framerate_still_mode.description: Reduce the framerate to save cpu/gpu on device displaying the live preview

framerate_video_mode.title: Framerate Video Mode
framerate_video_mode.description: Reduce the framerate to save cpu/gpu on device displaying the live preview

frame_skip_count.title: Frame Skip Count
frame_skip_count.description: Reduce the framerate_video_mode by frame_skip_count to save cpu/gpu on producing device as well as client devices. Choose 1 to emit every produced frame.

optimized_lowlight_short_exposure.title: Optimized Lowlight Short Exposure
optimized_lowlight_short_exposure.description: Raise AnalogueGain(=ISO) preferred before longer shutter times to avoid unsharp capture of moving people.

videostream_quality.title: Videostream Quality
videostream_quality.description: Lower quality results in less data to be transferred and may reduce load on devices.

original_still_quality.title: Original Still Quality
original_still_quality.description: Picamera produces original files, this is the quality for the JPG.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

device_identifier.title: Device Identifier
device_identifier.description: Device name (Windows) or index (Linux, Mac) of the webcam.

cam_resolution_width.title: Cam Resolution Width
cam_resolution_width.description: camera resolution width to capture high resolution photo

cam_resolution_height.title: Cam Resolution Height
cam_resolution_height.description: camera resolution height to capture high resolution photo

cam_framerate.title: Cam Framerate
cam_framerate.description: Camera capture framerate. If 0, the cameras default is used. 25 or 30 are framerates likely to work.

preview_resolution_reduce_factor.title: Preview Resolution Reduce Factor
preview_resolution_reduce_factor.description: Reduce the video and permanent livestream by this factor. Raise the factor to save CPU.

frame_skip_count.title: Frame Skip Count
frame_skip_count.description: Reduce the framerate_video_mode by frame_skip_count to save cpu/gpu on producing device as well as client devices. Choose 1 to emit every produced frame.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

device_identifier.title: Device Identifier
device_identifier.description: Device identifier (index 0 or 1 or /dev/xxx) of webcam.

pixel_format_fourcc.title: Pixel Format Fourcc
pixel_format_fourcc.description: MJPG is preferred usually. Some cameras (especially virtual cameras) do not support MJPG, so you can fall back to uncompressed YUYV here.

CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.title: Cam Resolution Width
CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.description: Camera resolution width in normal mode for preview and videos. Low resolution recommended to save resources.

CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.title: Cam Resolution Height
CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.description: Camera resolution width in normal mode for preview and videos. Low resolution recommended to save resources.

switch_to_high_resolution_for_stills.title: Switch To High Resolution For Stills
switch_to_high_resolution_for_stills.description: Enable to close camera, switch to higher resolution and grab one frame with below configuration. Resolution used for stills.

HIRES_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.title: Hires Cam Resolution Width
HIRES_CAM_RESOLUTION_WIDTH.description: camera resolution width to capture high resolution photo

HIRES_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.title: Hires Cam Resolution Height
HIRES_CAM_RESOLUTION_HEIGHT.description: camera resolution height to capture high resolution photo

flush_number_frames_after_switch.title: Flush Number Frames After Switch
flush_number_frames_after_switch.description: After switching the format, to high resolution, the camera might need some frames to accomodate to the light again. Use the lowest numer of frames that gives the same image as before in preview mode. If too low, images might apper darker or lighter than expected.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

framerate.title: Framerate
framerate.description: Reduce the framerate to save cpu/gpu on device displaying the live preview

emulate_hires_static_still.title: Emulate Hires Static Still
emulate_hires_static_still.description: Deliver high-resolution still image instead the demovideo. Useful to test the processing times by emulating hires cameras.

emulate_multicam_capture_devices.title: Emulate Multicam Capture Devices
emulate_multicam_capture_devices.description: Number of emulated cameras when asking for synchronized capture for wigglegrams.

orientation.title: Orientation
orientation.description: Choose the orientation of the camera. 0° is default orientation and applies no adjustment. The orientation will be set in the EXIF data so transformations are applied lossless.

index_cam_stills.title: Index Cam Stills
index_cam_stills.description: Index of one node below to capture stills.

index_cam_video.title: Index Cam Video
index_cam_video.description: Index of one backend below to capture live preview and video.

devices.title: Devices
devices.description: List all nodes to connect to the app. The list is considered as indexed list starting at 0. So the first node should have device_id=0. For 4 cameras you end up with 4 entries in the list and need to assign them device_id's 0,1,2,3.

retry_capture.title: Retry Capture
retry_capture.description: Number of attempts to gather a picture from backend.

countdown_camera_capture_offset.title: Countdown Camera Capture Offset
countdown_camera_capture_offset.description: Trigger camera capture by offset earlier (in seconds). 0 trigger exactly when countdown is 0. Use to compensate for delay in camera processing for better UX.

index_backend_stills.title: Index Backend Stills
index_backend_stills.description: Index of one backend below to capture stills.

index_backend_video.title: Index Backend Video
index_backend_video.description: Index of one backend below to capture live preview and video.

index_backend_multicam.title: Index Backend Multicam
index_backend_multicam.description: Index of one backend below used for multicamera images (wigglegrams).

group_backends.title: List of Camera Backends
group_backends.description: Configure the cameras here. Typical is only one camera, but it is also possible to use a DSLR for stills and another camera for the livestream.

GroupCameras.title: Camera Configurations
GroupCameras.description:
Choose backends for still images/high quality images captured on main backend.
If the livepreview is enabled, the video is captured from live backend (if configured)
or main backend.

admin_password.title: Admin Password
admin_password.description: Password to access the admin dashboard.

logging_level.title: Logging Level
logging_level.description: Log verbosity. File is writte to disc, and latest log is displayed also in UI.

users_delete_to_recycle_dir.title: Users Delete To Recycle Dir
users_delete_to_recycle_dir.description: If enabled, the captured files are moved to the recycle directory instead permanently deleted. Accidentally deleted images can be restored by the admin manually. Please inform users about the fact that no capture is deleted, if you enable the function!

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: (DEPRECATED in v8) Enable the automatic file transfer to USB service. Files are copied when the USB drive is inserted.

target_folder_name.title: Target Folder Name
target_folder_name.description: (DEPRECATED in v8) Name of the top-level folder on the USB drive where files will be copied to.

GroupFileTransfer.title: USB File Transfer Service Config (deprecated since v8)
GroupFileTransfer.description: Configuration for USB File Transfer Service.

keyboard_input_enabled.title: Keyboard Input Enabled
keyboard_input_enabled.description: Enable keyboard input globally. Keyup is catched in browsers connected to the app.

gpio_pin_shutdown.title: Gpio Pin Shutdown
gpio_pin_shutdown.description: GPIO pin to shutdown after holding it for 2 seconds.

gpio_pin_reboot.title: Gpio Pin Reboot
gpio_pin_reboot.description: GPIO pin to reboot after holding it for 2 seconds.

gpio_pin_job_next.title: Gpio Pin Job Next
gpio_pin_job_next.description: If a job is active, this pin is used to confirm/continue the job process if manual input is required for example to approve.

gpio_pin_job_reject.title: Gpio Pin Job Reject
gpio_pin_job_reject.description: If a job is active, this pin is used to reject a capture during approval.

gpio_pin_job_abort.title: Gpio Pin Job Abort
gpio_pin_job_abort.description: If a job is active, this pin is used to abort the job.

GroupHardwareInputOutput.title: Hardware Input/Output Config
GroupHardwareInputOutput.description: Configure hardware GPIO, keyboard and more. Find integration information in the documentation.

HIRES_STILL_QUALITY.title: Hires Still Quality
HIRES_STILL_QUALITY.description: Still JPEG full resolution quality, applied to download images and images with filter

full_still_length.title: Full Still Length
full_still_length.description: Minimum dimension of the longer side used to scale full captures. The shorter side is calculated to keep aspect ratio. For best performance choose as low as possible but still gives decent print quality. Example: 1500/6inch=250dpi

preview_still_length.title: Preview Still Length
preview_still_length.description: Minimum dimension of the longer side used to scale preview captures. The shorter side is calculated to keep aspect ratio.

thumbnail_still_length.title: Thumbnail Still Length
thumbnail_still_length.description: Minimum dimension of the longer side used to scale thumbnails captures. The shorter side is calculated to keep aspect ratio.

video_compatibility_mode.title: Video Compatibility Mode
video_compatibility_mode.description: Enable for improved video compatibility on iOS devices and Firefox. Might reduce resulting quality slightly.

remove_background_model.title: Remove Background Model
remove_background_model.description: Select from predefined models. Modnet and u2netp are packaged with the app, other models will be downloaded on demand and cached, so on first use of other models, the app needs internet access. u2netp is a reduced model that is fastest, modnet usually only slightly slower but provides good results.

fileformat_animations.title: Fileformat Animations
fileformat_animations.description: Format in which animations are stored. WebP is recommended nowadays. AVIF is a newer format, encodes fast, produces smallest files but is not yet broadly compatible. GIF is lower quality (max 256 colors), more compute intensive to encode but offers best compatibility. GIF is deprecated here.

fileformat_multicamera.title: Fileformat Multicamera
fileformat_multicamera.description: Format in which wigglegrams are stored. WebP is recommended nowadays. AVIF is a newer format, encodes fast, produces smallest files but is not yet broadly compatible. GIF is lower quality (max 256 colors), more compute intensive to encode but offers best compatibility. GIF is deprecated here.

GroupMediaprocessing.title: Process media after capture
GroupMediaprocessing.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

secret_key.title: Secret Key
secret_key.description: Secret to encrypt authentication data. If changed, login authorization is invalidated.

cmd_shutdown.title: Cmd Shutdown
cmd_shutdown.description: Command to shutdown when requested by the app. Change it if you have custom UPS solutions that need to poweroff properly.

cmd_reboot.title: Cmd Reboot
cmd_reboot.description: Command to reboot when requested by the app. Change it if you have custom UPS solutions that need to poweroff properly.

GroupMisc.title: Miscellaneous Config
GroupMisc.description: Quite advanced or experimental, usually not necessary to touch. Can change any time.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: (DEPRECATED in v8) Enable qr share service. To enable URL needs to be configured and dl.php script setup properly.

shareservice_url.title: Shareservice Url
shareservice_url.description: (DEPRECATED in v8) URL of php script that is used to serve files and share via QR code. The default is a landingpage with further instructions how to setup.

shareservice_apikey.title: Shareservice Apikey
shareservice_apikey.description: (DEPRECATED in v8) Key to secure the download php script. Set the key in dl.php script to same value. Only if correct key is provided the shareservice works properly.

enabled_custom.title: Enabled Custom
enabled_custom.description: Enable qr share service. To enable URL needs to be configured and dl.php script setup properly.

share_custom_qr_url.title: Share Custom Qr Url
share_custom_qr_url.description: URL displayed as QR code to image for download. Need you to sync the files on your own or allow the user to access via hotspot. {identifier} is replaced by the actual item's id, {filename} is replaced by the actual filename on the photobooth-data, in QR code.

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: Specify the theme for the app. Set to system for automatic switching based on system/browser settings or force the light/dark theme.

show_gallery_on_frontpage.title: Show Gallery On Frontpage
show_gallery_on_frontpage.description: Show button to gallery on frontpage.

show_admin_on_frontpage.title: Show Admin On Frontpage
show_admin_on_frontpage.description: Show button to admin center, usually only during setup.

admin_button_invisible.title: Admin Button Invisible
admin_button_invisible.description: If button is shown, it can still be rendered invisible. If enabled, the button is 100% transparent and 5 clicks each within 500ms are required to access the admin login.

show_frontpage_timeout.title: Show Frontpage Timeout
show_frontpage_timeout.description: Idle timeout in minutes after which the app switches to the frontpage again.

enable_automatic_slideshow.title: Enable Automatic Slideshow
enable_automatic_slideshow.description: Enable a random slideshow after some time without any user interaction.

show_automatic_slideshow_timeout.title: Show Automatic Slideshow Timeout
show_automatic_slideshow_timeout.description: Timeout in seconds after which the slideshow starts.

enable_livestream_when_idle.title: Enable Livestream When Idle
enable_livestream_when_idle.description: When idle, the cameras livestream is displayed permanently.

enable_livestream_when_active.title: Enable Livestream When Active
enable_livestream_when_active.description: When countdown or capture is active, the cameras livestream is displayed.

livestream_mirror_effect.title: Livestream Mirror Effect
livestream_mirror_effect.description: Flip livestream horizontally to create a mirror effect feeling more natural to users.

livestream_blurredbackground.title: Livestream Blurredbackground
livestream_blurredbackground.description: Display the livestream blurred in the background of the actual livestream covering the full screen. This might look nice if the livestream resolution does not match the screen's aspect ratio. Check cpu usage on low power devices.

enable_livestream_frameoverlay.title: Enable Livestream Frameoverlay
enable_livestream_frameoverlay.description: Enable to overlay livestream_frameoverlay_image the livestream.

livestream_frameoverlay_image.title: Livestream Frameoverlay Image
livestream_frameoverlay_image.description: When enabled, the frame is overlayed the livestream. This image is not used in the postprocessing. If mirroreffect is on, it will also be mirrored. Text in the frame appears in the wrong direction but the final image is correct.

livestream_frameoverlay_mirror_effect.title: Livestream Frameoverlay Mirror Effect
livestream_frameoverlay_mirror_effect.description: Flip the frame overlaid horizontally to create a mirror effect. Useful to flip also if video is flipped when people shall align to the frame. If there is text in the frame it's also mirrored.

FRONTPAGE_TEXT.title: Frontpage Text
FRONTPAGE_TEXT.default:
Hey!
Let's take some pictures!
📷

TAKEPIC_MSG_TIME.title: Takepic Msg Time
TAKEPIC_MSG_TIME.description: Offset in seconds, the smile-icon shall be shown.

TAKEPIC_MSG_TEXT.title: Takepic Msg Text
TAKEPIC_MSG_TEXT.description: Message to display at the end of the capture countdown.

AUTOCLOSE_NEW_ITEM_ARRIVED.title: Autoclose New Item Arrived
AUTOCLOSE_NEW_ITEM_ARRIVED.description: Timeout in seconds a new item popup closes automatically.

GALLERY_EMPTY_MSG.title: Gallery Empty Msg
GALLERY_EMPTY_MSG.description: Message displayed if gallery is empty.
GALLERY_EMPTY_MSG.default:
Empty, Zero, Nada! 🤷‍♂️
Let's take some pictures!
📷💕

gallery_show_qrcode.title: Gallery Show Qrcode
gallery_show_qrcode.description: Show QR code in gallery. If shareservice is enabled the URL is automatically generated, if not go to share config and provide URL.

qrcode_text_above.title: Qrcode Text Above
qrcode_text_above.description: Display text above the QR code.

qrcode_text_below.title: Qrcode Text Below
qrcode_text_below.description: Display text below the QR code.
qrcode_text_below.default: Scan above code with your phone.

qrcode_link_codes.title: Qrcode Link Codes
qrcode_link_codes.description: Clickable link is added to the QR code itself. This can be helpful for testing but should be disabled on a production system to avoid users escape out of the app.

gallery_show_filter.title: Gallery Show Filter
gallery_show_filter.description: Show filter provided by plugins. Pilgram2 filter are included in the app. See documentation to extend and build your own plugin.

gallery_show_download.title: Gallery Show Download
gallery_show_download.description: Show a download button in gallery.

gallery_show_delete.title: Gallery Show Delete
gallery_show_delete.description: Show a delete button in gallery.

gallery_show_shareprint.title: Gallery Show Shareprint
gallery_show_shareprint.description: Show the share/print buttons in gallery.

keycode.title: Keycode
keycode.description: Define keyboard keys to trigger actions.

KeyboardTrigger.title: Keyboard triggers configuration
KeyboardTrigger.description: Configure trigger the user can interact with. Sources are GPIO and keyboard.

MediaitemTypes.title: MediaitemTypes
MediaitemTypes.description:
SQLalchemy persists the name, fastapi validates against the value.
We just set name==value so it works in both worlds without any conversion.
Ref: https://github.com/fastapi/fastapi/discussions/11098

countdown_capture.title: Countdown Capture
countdown_capture.description: Countdown in seconds, when user starts a capture process

countdown_capture_second_following.title: Countdown Capture Second Following
countdown_capture_second_following.description: Countdown in seconds, used for second and following captures for collages

ask_approval_each_capture.title: Ask Approval Each Capture
ask_approval_each_capture.description: Stop after every capture to ask user if he would like to continue or redo the capture. If disabled captures are granted as approved always.

approve_autoconfirm_timeout.title: Approve Autoconfirm Timeout
approve_autoconfirm_timeout.description: If user is required to approve collage captures, after this timeout, the job continues and user confirmation is assumed.

show_individual_captures_in_gallery.title: Show Individual Captures In Gallery
show_individual_captures_in_gallery.description: Show individual captures in the gallery. Hidden captures are still stored in the data folder. (Note: changing this setting will not change visibility of already captured images).

MultiImageJobControl.title: Job control for multiple captures
MultiImageJobControl.description: Configure job control affecting the procedure.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

MulticameraConfigurationSet.title: Postprocess multicamera captures
MulticameraConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

countdown_capture.title: Countdown Capture
countdown_capture.description: Countdown in seconds, when user starts a capture process.

show_individual_captures_in_gallery.title: Show Individual Captures In Gallery
show_individual_captures_in_gallery.description: Show individual captures in the gallery. Hidden captures are still stored in the data folder. (Note: changing this setting will not change visibility of already captured images).

MulticameraJobControl.title: Job control for wigglegram-multicamera captures
MulticameraJobControl.description: Configure job control affecting the procedure.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of each frame in milliseconds. Wigglegrams look good usually between 100-200ms duration.

MulticameraProcessing.title: Wigglegram-multicamera processing
MulticameraProcessing.description: Configure stages how to process collage after capture.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

handles_images_only.title: Handles Images Only
handles_images_only.description: Enable if this share type can handle only still images.

ShareConfigurationSet.title: Process mediaitem before printing on paper
ShareConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process mediaitem before printing on paper.

share_command.title: Share Command
share_command.description: Command issued to share/print. Use {filename} as placeholder for the mediaitem to be shared/printed. Also available: {media_type}=[image,collage,video,animation] and {action_config_name} which is the action name defined in the config.

ask_user_for_parameter_input.title: Ask User For Parameter Input
ask_user_for_parameter_input.description: If enabled, when the share button is activated, a dialog pops up to input below configured parameters.

parameters_dialog_caption.title: Parameters Dialog Caption
parameters_dialog_caption.description: Caption of the dialog popup displaying the parameters.

parameters_dialog_action_icon.title: Parameters Dialog Action Icon
parameters_dialog_action_icon.description: Icon used for the action button (any icon from material icons, see documentation).

parameters_dialog_action_label.title: Parameters Dialog Action Label
parameters_dialog_action_label.description: Text used for the action button as label.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: Define input fields the user needs to enter on share.

share_blocked_time.title: Share Blocked Time
share_blocked_time.description: Block queue print until time is passed. Time in seconds.

ShareProcessing.title: Share/Print Actions
ShareProcessing.description: Configure options to share or print images.

key.title: Key
key.description: Define the parameter key that is replaced in the command. Example: Set to 'copies' to replace {copies} in the command by the value.

label.title: Label
label.description: Label the field, displayed to the user.

ui_type.title: Ui Type
ui_type.description: Display type of the parameter in the UI. 'int' displays ➕➖ buttons in the UI. 'input' displays an input box. This affects only the UI, all parameter are interpreted as strings.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value if the user does not change it.

ShareProcessingParameters.title: Additional parameters
ShareProcessingParameters.description: Configure additional parameter for the share command to input by the user.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

SingleImageConfigurationSet.title: Postprocess single captures
SingleImageConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

countdown_capture.title: Countdown Capture
countdown_capture.description: Countdown in seconds, when user starts a capture process.

SingleImageJobControl.title: Job control for single captures
SingleImageJobControl.description: Configure job control affecting the procedure.

remove_background.title: Remove Background
remove_background.description: Use AI to remove the background from the captured image. Results may vary. There are different models available in the mediaprocessing section.

fill_background_enable.title: Fill Background Enable
fill_background_enable.description: Apply solid color background to captured image (useful only if image is extended or background removed)

fill_background_color.title: Fill Background Color
fill_background_color.description: Solid color used to fill background.

img_background_enable.title: Img Background Enable
img_background_enable.description: Add image from file to background (useful only if image is extended or background removed)

img_background_file.title: Img Background File
img_background_file.description: Image file to use as background filling transparent area. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

img_frame_file.title: Img Frame File
img_frame_file.description: Image file to which the captured image is mounted to. Frame determines the output image size! Photos are visible through transparant parts. Image needs to be transparent (PNG). File needs to be located in userdata/*

texts.title: Texts
texts.description: Text to overlay on images after capture. Pos_x/Pos_y measure in pixel starting 0/0 at top-left in image. Font to use in text stages. File needs to be located in working directory/userdata/*

SingleImageProcessing.title: Single captures processing after capture
SingleImageProcessing.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

Trigger.title: Trigger configuration
Trigger.description: Configure trigger the user can interact with. Sources are GPIO and keyboard.

show_button.title: Show Button
show_button.description: Show the button to trigger the process.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Icon used for the button (any icon from material icons, see documentation).

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to identify, only used for display in admin center.

VideoConfigurationSet.title: Postprocess video captures
VideoConfigurationSet.description: Configure stages how to process images after capture.

countdown_capture.title: Countdown Capture
countdown_capture.description: Countdown in seconds, when user starts a capture process.

VideoJobControl.title: Job control for video captures
VideoJobControl.description: Configure job control affecting the procedure.

video_duration.title: Video Duration
video_duration.description: Maximum duration of the video. Users can stop earlier or capture is automatically stopped after set time.

boomerang.title: Boomerang
boomerang.description: Create boomerang videos, the video is replayed reverse automatically.

boomerang_speed.title: Boomerang Speed
boomerang_speed.description: Speed up the resulting boomerang. 1 is normal speed, 2 is double.

VideoProcessing.title: Video Processing
VideoProcessing.description: Configure stages how to process collage after capture.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description just for you to distinguish the devices.

address.title: Address
address.description: Host or IP address to connect to the node.

base_port.title: Base Port
base_port.description: Base port to connect to the node.

WigglecamNodes.title: Each camera is hooked to a node.
